9.03.01: GENERAL PROVISIONS:
   A.   Short Title: This chapter shall be known and may be cited as LYON
COUNTY UTILITIES WATER ORDINANCE.
   B.   Enabling Statutes: This chapter is adopted pursuant to Nevada Revised
Statutes.
   C.   Words And Phrases: For the purpose of this chapter, all words used
herein in the present tense shall include the future; all words in the plural
number shall include the singular number; he may be used for she, she for he
and all words in the singular number shall include the plural number.
   D.   Water System Enterprise: LCUD will furnish a system, works and
undertaking used for and useful in obtaining, conserving and disposing of water
for public and private uses, including all parts of the enterprise, all
appurtenances to it, and lands, easements, rights in land, water rights,
contract rights, franchises, and other water supply, storage and distribution
facilities and equipment.
   E.   Separability: If any section, subsection, sentence, clause or phrase of
this chapter or the application thereof to any person or circumstances is for
any reason held to be unconstitutional or invalid, such decision shall not
affect the validity of the remaining portions of this chapter or the
application of such provision to other persons or circumstances. The board of
commissioners hereby declares that it would have passed this chapter or any
section, subsection, sentence, clause or phrase hereof irrespective of the fact
that any one or more sections, subsections, sentences, clauses or phrases be
declared to be unconstitutional.
   F.   Pressure Conditions: All applicants for service connections or water
service shall be required to accept such conditions of pressure and service as
are provided by the distributing system at the location of the proposed service
connection, and to hold LCUD harmless for any damages arising out of low
pressure or high pressure conditions or interruptions in service.
   G.   Maintenance Of Water Pressure And Shutting Down For Emergency Repairs:
LCUD shall not accept any responsibility for the maintenance of pressure, and
it reserves the right to discontinue service while making repairs and when
necessary for the protection of property. Consumers dependent upon a continuous
supply should provide emergency storage.
   H.   Tampering With LCUD Property: No one except an employee or
representative of LCUD shall at any time in any manner operate the curb valves
or meter valves, main valves, gates or control valves of LCUD's system; or
interfere with meters or their connections, lock out tags, meter stakes, street
mains or other parts of the water system. Violators will be prosecuted under
Nevada Revised Statutes 704.800.
   I.   Penalty For Violation: For the failure of the customer to comply with
all or any part of this chapter, and any ordinance, resolution or order fixing
rates, charges and penalties of LCUD, the customer's service shall be
discontinued and the water shall not be supplied to such customer until he
shall have complied with the rule or regulation, rate or charge which he has
violated or, in the event that he cannot comply with said rule or regulation,
until he shall have satisfied LCUD that in the future he will comply with all
the rules and regulations established by ordinance of LCUD and with all rates
and charges.
   J.   Posting: The adoption of this chapter shall be entered in the minutes
of the board of commissioners and certified copies hereof shall be posted in
accordance with the state of Nevada open meeting law, Nevada Revised Statutes
241, section 020, pertaining to posting requirements.
   K.   Relief Of Application: When any person by reason of special
circumstances, is of the opinion that any provision of this chapter is unjust
or inequitable as applied to his premises, he may make written application to
the board through the utilities director stating the special circumstances,
citing the provision complained of, and requesting suspension or modification
of that provision as applied to his premises.
If such application involves nonpolicy related issues, the utilities director
may act on the request. If the person is not satisfied with the utilities
director's decision, that person may make a written appeal to the county
manager within ten (10) working days. The county manager will respond in
writing within fifteen (15) working days. The applicant may make a written
appeal to the county manager's decision to the board within ten (10) working
days of the county manager's decision. The appeal will be placed on a board
agenda within thirty (30) calendar days.
   L.   Relief Of Own Motion: The board of commissioners may, on its own
motion, find that by reason of special circumstances any provision of this
regulation and chapter should be suspended or modified as applied to a
particular premises and may, by resolution, order such suspension or
modification for such premises during the period of such special circumstances,
or any part thereof.
   M.   Ruling Final: All rulings of the board shall be final. All rulings of
the county manager shall be final unless appealed in writing to the board
within ten (10) working days. When appealed, the board's ruling shall be final.
(Ord. 504, 1-18-2007)
9.03.02: DEFINITIONS:
When used in this chapter, the following terms shall have the meanings defined
below:
AGENT: A duly authorized individual to act for the legal owner. Agents are
required to have notarized authorization from the legal owner if owner is not
present.
APPLICANT: The person, firm, association, corporation or governmental agency
applying for water service.
APPLICATION: The written request on a form provided by LCUD for water service
as distinguished from an inquiry as to the availability or charges for such
service.
AVERAGE MONTH: Thirty (30) days.
BILLING PERIOD: The regular billing period will be monthly or at the discretion
of the LCUD.
BOARD: The Lyon County board of county commissioners.
BUILDING: Any structure used for human habitation or a place of business,
recreation or other purpose containing water facilities.
CAPACITY RATIO: The relative flow of each water service line size as compared
to that of a three-fourths inch (3/4") service.
Water Service Line Capacity Ratio
(In Inches)
Water Service Line Capacity Ratio
(In Inches)
                   
   1               1.67
   1.5             3.33
   2               5.33
   3               10.00
   4               16.67
   6               33.33
   8               53.33
   10              76.65
 
CONNECTION - SUPPLY LATERAL: The pipeline and appurtenant facilities such as
the curb stop, meter, meter box and piping all used to extend water service
from a main to premises. Where services are divided at the curb or property
line to serve several customers, each such branch service shall be deemed a
separate service connection.
CONTRACTOR: An individual, firm, corporation, partnership or association duly
licensed by the state of Nevada and approved by LCUD to perform the type of
work to be done under the permit.
COST: The cost of labor, material, transportation, supervision, engineering,
and all other necessary overhead expenses.
COUNTY: The county of Lyon.
COUNTY MANAGER: The county manager of Lyon County.
CROSS CONNECTION: Any physical or potential connection between the piping
system from the LCUD service and that of any other water supply that is not, or
cannot be, approved as safe and potable for human consumption, whereby water
from the unapproved source may be forced or drawn into LCUD distribution mains.
CUSTOMER: In the case of single-family or individually metered multiple-family
residences, the customer shall be the owner of the property served, but the
billing for service may be sent to the owner in care of his agent or renter.
For commercial services, the person in whose name service is rendered, as
evidenced by the signature on the application or contract for that service, or
in the absence of a signed instrument, by the receipt and payment of bills
regularly issued in his name regardless of the identity of the actual user of
the service.
DATE OF PRESENTATION: The date upon which a bill or notice is mailed or
postmarked or delivered to the customer by LCUD.
DESIGNATED PROPERTY MANAGER: That individual or business entity so designated
by the owner to act on his/her behalf.
DIRECTOR: The person appointed by the county manager in accordance with title
1, chapter 7 of this code to perform the duties of utilities director.
ENGINEER: The engineer appointed and acting for LCUD and shall be a registered
civil engineer in the state of Nevada.
FIXTURE UNIT: As defined in the latest edition of the uniform plumbing code,
International Association of Plumbing and Mechanical Officials as adopted by
Lyon County.
FLAT RATE SERVICE: An unmetered water service.
HOUSE PIPING: All piping and fittings installed within the house or building up
to and including the last fitting on the outside of an exterior wall.
INSPECTOR: That person so designated by the utilities director to perform
inspections, tests, fixture unit counts, and related work in determining
compliance with LCUD construction specifications, standards and ordinances.
LCUD: The Lyon County utilities department acting through its duly authorized
officers or employees within the scope of their respective duties. May also be
used to mean service provider for another service area.
LAW: Any statute, rule, ordinance, bylaw or regulation established by federal,
state, county, or municipal authorities.
LIVING UNIT: Any residence, apartment, habitation or other structure to be
occupied by a single person or family requiring water service.
MAIN: A water line in a street, highway, alley or easement used for public and
private fire protection and for general distribution of water.
MAIN EXTENSION AND/OR CAPACITY ENHANCEMENT: The extension or replacement of
water distribution mains and necessary facilities beyond existing service
facilities in accordance with the provisions of this chapter applicable to main
extensions and/or capacity enhancements.
METERED SERVICE: A service for which charges are computed on the basis of
measured quantities of water, sewage, or liquid wastes.
OWNER: The person owning the property, or the person in whose name the legal
title to the property appears, by deed duly recorded in the county recorder's
office, or the person in possession of the property or building under claim of,
or exercising acts of ownership over same for himself, or as executor,
administrator, guardian or trustee of the owner.
PERMANENT SERVICE: A service which, in the opinion of LCUD, is of a permanent
and established character. The use of water may be continuous, intermittent or
seasonal in nature.
PERMIT: Any written authorization required pursuant to this or any other
regulation of LCUD for the installation of any waterworks.
PERSON: Any individual, partnership, corporation, governmental agency, or other
organization operating as a single business entity.
PREMISES: All that real property of a single integrated operation under one
name which operation may involve one or more buildings, locations or services,
provided: a) such buildings, locations, or services are to a single unit of
property; or b) such buildings, locations or services that are on two (2) or
more units of property immediately adjoining, except for intervening public
highways, streets, alleys, or waterways.
PRIVATE WATER SYSTEM: Any system served water by LCUD under the responsibility
of others for ownership and maintenance.
REGULAR WATER SERVICE: Water service and facilities rendered for normal
domestic, commercial and industrial purposes on a permanent basis, and the
water available therefor.
SERVICE CLASSIFICATION: Shall be defined as follows:
Commercial Service: Service to customers engaged in selling, warehousing, or
distributing a commodity, in some business activity, or in a profession, or in
some form of economic or social activity (offices, stores, clubs, schools,
hotels, etc.) and for purposes that do not come directly under another
classification of service.
Domestic Service: Service to a residential customer.
Industrial Service: Service to customers engaged in a process which creates or
changes raw or unfinished materials into another form or product (factories,
mills, machine shops, pumping plants, etc., i.e., in extractive fabrication or
processing activities).
Irrigation Service: Service to customers for agricultural, floricultural or
horticultural use.
Multi-Family Residential Unit: The place of residence of a single family within
a multi-unit complex. The family premises and the service thereto, whether a
separate building, multiple buildings, a townhouse, an apartment, a mobile
home, a condominium or any other type of living unit, and the supporting
services for a single family.
Private Fire Protection Service: Water service and facilities for building
sprinkler systems, hydrants, hose reels and other facilities installed on
private property for fire protection and the water available therefor.
Public Fire Protection Service: Water service and facilities of the entire
water supply, storage and distribution system of LCUD, including the fire
hydrants affixed thereto, and the water available for fire protection,
excepting house service connections and appurtenances thereto.
Single-Family Residential: A single-family residential customer and the
services for residential purposes to a single-family dwelling, the residential
portion of a building, an individual apartment, a condominium, a mobile home, a
multiple dwelling or the portion thereof occupied as the home, residence or
sleeping place for one or more persons.
   A. This service classification can include a family operated business within
or part of the family residence, and the supporting services to the family
residence, and the supporting services to the family residential customer on
the same unsubdivided premises as the family residential unit. The fixture unit
count for these services shall be added to the single-family unit in
determining connection charges and water rights requirements.
SERVICE CONNECTIONS: The point of connection of the customer's piping with
LCUD's facilities which is most commonly the connection point on the discharge
side of the meter pit or curb stop valve. Where the meter is located other than
at the property line, the private water system from the corp valve on the main
shall be maintained by the owner of the property.
SERVICE SIZE FOR BILLING PURPOSES: Water service billing is based on a single
meter size even when compound meters are used. The water service for billing
purposes is based on the calculated demand using the methods based in the
uniform plumbing code or from standard engineering practice and correlated to a
standard meter flow rate capacity. This calculated service size for billing
purposes may vary from the actual meter size installed. Certain site conditions
necessitate the installation of a larger meter than required by the flow
capacity. Billing will be based on the calculated flow capacity for that
connection.
STREET: Any public highway, road, street, avenue, alley, way, public place,
public easement or right of way.
TEMPORARY WATER SERVICE: Water service and facilities rendered for construction
work and other uses of limited duration, and the water available therefor.
UTILITIES SUPERINTENDENT: The person appointed to superintend the water and
sewer works.
WATER DEPARTMENT: The board of commissioners of Lyon County performing
functions related to LCUD's water service, together with the county manager,
utilities director, utilities superintendent, utilities engineer and other duly
authorized representatives.
WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM - PRIVATE SERVICE LINE: All piping between the house piping
and the service connection as described in the definition of "service
connections" in this section.
WATER WASTE: The negligent or wasteful discharge of water from a hose,
sprinkler head, irrigation pipe, water main, indoor and outdoor plumbing
fixtures and/or water service, which is flowing into a street, roadside ditch,
storm drain, driveway, adjacent property and/or sidewalk creating puddles,
streams of water or flooding as further described in subsection
9.03.07B and section
9.03.16 of this chapter.
WILL-SERVE LETTER: A letter written by LCUD at the request of an applicant with
respect to a single residential unit, subdivision, commercial or multi-family
residential project to confirm: a) that the subdivision or project is within
LCUD's boundaries and b) that, if water is available and deeded to Lyon County
to serve the proposed connection(s) at the time service is requested under the
standards set forth in section
9.03.05 of this chapter, LCUD is willing to provide water service thereto upon
compliance with all LCUD requirements and payment of all applicable LCUD fees
and charges. (Ord. 504, 1-18-2007) !DEFEND!
9.03.03: NOTICES:
   A.   Notices To Customers: Notices from LCUD to an owner or customer will
normally be given in writing, and either delivered, posted on a door or mailed
to the last known address. Where conditions warrant and in emergencies, LCUD
may resort to notification either by telephone or messenger.
   B.   Notices From Owners Or Customers: Notice from the owner or customer to
LCUD may be given by him or his authorized representative in writing to LCUD at
the office or by e-mail. Owner or customer must have written proof that LCUD
received the e-mail. (Ord. 504, 1-18-2007)
9.03.04: WATER DEPARTMENT:
   A.   Creation: A water department is hereby created comprised of the board
of commissioners, county manager and utilities director.
   B.   County Manager: The county manager shall have full responsibility for
the maintenance, operation and construction of the waterworks and system in
accordance with title 1, chapter 7 of this code.
   C.   Utilities Director: The position of utilities director is hereby
created. He/she shall have charge of the utilities of LCUD. This shall include
all maintenance, operation and construction of the water and sewer works, and
the billing for and collecting the charges herein provided. He/she shall
perform such other duties as shall be determined by the county manager in
accordance with title 1, chapter 7 of this code.
   D.   Inspections: LCUD shall perform inspections on all public water and
sewer construction within LCUD's service area to assure compliance with LCUD
standards and specifications. All existing residential, commercial and
industrial establishments are subject to inspection for proper operation of
backflow prevention, cross connection control, investigation of potential water
waste and pressure regulating devices. Inspections shall be scheduled with the
property owner or property manager. If the property owner or property manager
refuses access, subsection F of this section shall apply.
   E.   Performance Of Duties: The foregoing duties of the utilities director
may be performed by the utilities superintendent or by a designated employee or
employees, as the county manager in accordance with title 1, chapter 7 of this
code may direct, so long as those decisions or actions that require
professional engineering judgment are performed by a registered professional
engineer.
   F.   Consequences Of Denial Of Entry Or Access: Where an owner or user,
after having received reasonable notice from LCUD refuses to permit properly
identified LCUD personnel to enter or have access to premises or facilities in
accordance with the above sections, LCUD may forthwith give written notice of
its intent to terminate water and/or sewer service to such user. Such notice
shall be given in accordance with sections 9.03.09, "Billing", and 9.03.10,
"Discontinuance Of Service", of this chapter, and termination based on these
sections shall be treated as a termination for refusal of access under this
section.
   G.   Violation: Any person found to be violating any provision of this
chapter or any ordinance, rule or regulation of LCUD, shall be served by the
LCUD with written notice stating the nature of the violation and providing a
reasonable time limit for the satisfactory correction thereof. The offender
shall, within the period of time stated in such notice, permanently cease all
violations. The owner shall be held strictly responsible for any and all acts
of their agents, renters or employees done under the provisions of this chapter
or any other ordinance, rule or regulation of LCUD.
      1.   Amounts: Violations of these regulations shall be subject to civil
monetary penalties established by: a) applicable Nevada statutes or
administrative code, b) Nevada division of environmental protection and Lyon
County and c) by such penalty schedules as may from time to time be adopted by
the board of commissioners.
      2.   Continuing Violations: For purposes of the computation of penalties,
each day of a continuing violation of these regulations shall be deemed to be
separate violation.
   H.   Water Pressure And Supply: LCUD assumes no responsibility for loss or
damage due to lack of water or pressure fluctuations, either high or low, and
merely agrees to furnish such quantities and pressures as are available in its
general distribution system. LCUD will endeavor to give reasonable notice to
customers before a curtailment of services; however, LCUD shall not be liable
for shutdowns or variations in pressures or water quantities that occur without
prior notice by LCUD. (Ord. 504, 1-18-2007)
9.03.05: APPLICATION FOR REGULAR WATER SERVICE:
   A.   Form Of Application: A property owner or his agent shall make
application for regular water service on a form provided by LCUD.
      1.   Purpose: The application is merely a written request for service on
a form provided by LCUD and does not bind the applicant to take service;
neither does it bind LCUD to serve.
      2.   Calculation Of Fixture Units: The number and type of fixture units
shall be as defined in the uniform plumbing code as adopted herein, with the
exception of exterior landscaping irrigation systems. The fixture unit charge
for exterior landscaping irrigation systems will only be assessed upon
application for an irrigation meter. Other interpretations or calculations of
fixture unit counts for fixtures not listed in the uniform plumbing code shall
be at the discretion of the utilities director or his designee.
   B.   Undertaking Of Applicant: Such application will signify the customer's
and owner's willingness and intention to comply with this chapter and other
ordinances or regulations relating to the regular water service and to make
payment for water service required.
   C.   Payment For Previous Service, Special Assessments: An application will
not be honored unless payment in full has been made for water and other
services previously rendered to the applicant or owner by LCUD, and unless all
special assessments on the parcel of land to be served are paid current.
   D.   Installation Charges: Where a regular charge has been fixed for the
type of service connection desired, such regular charge shall be paid in
advance by the applicant. Where there is no regular charge, LCUD reserves the
right to require the applicant to deposit an amount equal to the estimated cost
of such service connection. Only duly authorized employees, or agents of LCUD
or LCUD approved contractors will be authorized to install service connections.
   E.   Installation Of Services: Service installations will be made only to
property abutting distribution mains as have been constructed in public
streets, alleys or easements. Services installed in new subdivisions prior to
the construction of streets or in advance of street improvements must be
accepted by the applicant in the installed location. If an applicant desires a
change, all costs associated with a change in location or alteration of the
water service shall be borne by the applicant.
   F.   Changes In Customer’s Equipment Or Usage: Customers making any material
change in the size, character or extent of the equipment or operations
utilizing water service, or whose change in operations results in a large
increase in the use of water, shall immediately give LCUD written notice of the
nature of the change, and, if necessary, amend their application. If annual
water usage exceeds the amount of water rights provided for the property, the
owner will be required to deed the additional water rights to the county with
clear title.
   G.   Size And Location: LCUD reserves the right to determine the size of
service connections and their location with respect to the boundaries of the
premises to be served. The laying of consumer’s pipeline to the curb shall not
be done until the location of the service connection has been approved by the
LCUD.
   H.   Curb Stop Valves: Every service connection installed shall be equipped
with an approved valve on the inlet side of the meter. If a valve or related
equipment is damaged by the customer’s use or negligence, repairs and/or
replacement shall be at the customer’s expense.
   I.   Domestic, Commercial And Industrial Service Connection: It shall be
unlawful to maintain a connection that does not conform to the following rules:
      1.   Separate Building: Each house or building under separate ownership
must be provided with a separate service connection. Two (2) or more houses
under one ownership and on the same lot or parcel of land may be supplied
through the same service connection, if sufficient water rights have been
provided. LCUD must approve all installations and may require modifications to
the existing system.
      2.   Single Connection: Not more than one service connection for domestic
or commercial supply shall be installed for one building, except as approved by
LCUD.
      3.   Different Owners: A service connection shall not be used to supply
an adjoining property of a different owner or to supply property of the same
owner across a property line, street or alley.
      4.   Divided Property: Each service connection shall be considered as
belonging to the lot or parcel of land which it directly enters prior to any
lot line adjustments. Additional service connections may be required.
   J.   Service Connections: The service connections extending from the water
main to the property line and including the meter, meter box and meter valve,
shall be maintained by LCUD except as otherwise stated. All pipes and fixtures
extending or lying beyond the meter pit shall be installed and maintained by
the owner of the property. Where the meter is located other than at the
property line, the private water system from the corp valve on the main shall
be owned and maintained by the owner of the property.
   K.   Individual Liability For Joint Service: Two (2) or more parties who
join in one application for service shall be jointly and severally liable for
payment of bills and shall be billed by means of single periodic bill. The
owner is ultimately responsible in any case.
   L.   Special Cases: LCUD will require a written contract with special
guarantee from applicants whose unusual characteristics of load would require
excessive investment in facilities or whose requirements for service are of a
special nature. Applicants may be required to either construct or fund
improvements required to serve their project.
   M.   Water Used Without Application Being Made: An owner taking possession
of premises and using water from an active service connection without having
made application to LCUD for water service shall be held liable for the water
delivered from the date of such use or possession or the earliest date of
occupancy which can be reasonably established. Where services are not metered,
the quantity consumed will be estimated. If proper application for water
service is not made within seven (7) days of notification to do so by LCUD and
if accumulated bills for service are not paid immediately, the service may be
discontinued by LCUD without further notice.
   N.   Connection To System Required Within Three Hundred Sixty Five Days Of
Application: Any application that has been accepted by LCUD shall be considered
vacated if the applicant fails to commence construction and connection to
LCUD’s water system within three hundred sixty five (365) calendar days of such
acceptance. Any fees collected for such application that are unused, shall be
returned to the applicant, upon written request, and a new application and
payment of fees will be required before service will be provided. Connection
fees shall be charged at the rate in effect on the day of application.
Connection(s) not made within three hundred sixty five (365) days will be
subject to the current rates in effect at the time of connection. Previously
paid connection fees shall be credited to the new connection fee rate. Payment
of connection fees constitutes acceptance of a new service connection
application by LCUD. No fees will be refunded after connection.
   O.   Changes In Use Or Uses Of Served Property: Any changes in the use or
uses of properties served by regular water service which may affect the service
classification under which it is served or the number of fixture units served
must have the prior approval of LCUD. Examples of such changes would be adding
plumbing fixtures not previously approved in applying for service; modifying a
residence to accommodate more single-family units than were approved, changes
to irrigation systems, or such other changes that would similarly change the
character of the building and/or grounds. Such changes in use shall be subject
to an additional connection charge and may require additional water rights. If
such changes are made without application they shall be considered to have been
made in violation and be subject to discontinuance of service as provided in
section
9.03.10 of this chapter.
   P.   General: All costs and expenses related to the installation and
connection of any water service or other work for which a permit has been
issued shall be borne by the applicant, and shall be in addition to all fees,
service and connection charges. The owner shall indemnify LCUD for any loss or
damage that may directly or indirectly be related to the work. All work shall
be made by or be authorized by LCUD for any new construction, addition,
remodel, or demolition that may result in a change of water use or will require
a building permit. Written approval and final acceptance by LCUD is required.
   Q.   Connection Charge: The following charges are established by the board
and shall be collected at the time of issuing the permit for a water
connection. Connection fees shall be charged at the rate in effect on the day
of application to LCUD. Connections not made within three hundred sixty five
(365) days will be subject to the current rates in effect at the time of
connection. Previously paid connection fees shall be credited to the new
connection fee rate. No fees will be refunded after connection.
      1.   Units Within The Service Area: Water connection fees shall be
established by the board. Each dwelling or multiple dwellings on a single
parcel shall constitute a separate unit.
      2.   Fire Protection: Connection fees for fire protection shall be
established by the board.
      3.   Units Outside Of The Service Area: Reserved for future use.
      4.   Remodeling Connection Charges: If remodeling necessitates upgrade of
the water meter, connection fees shall be charged equal to the fee for that
meter size as described in subsection Q.1. of this section minus: a) the total
in connection fees paid to LCUD previously or b) water connection fee for the
existing meter size, whichever results in the lower net additional connection
charges. Additional water rights may also be required based on a fixture unit
count of the entire property including existing uses plus proposed additions.
      5.   Plan Check Fee: In accordance with LCUD’s most recently adopted fee
schedule, a plan check fee shall be required for all plans requiring LCUD’s
approval. Each plan revision requiring rechecking shall be assessed an
additional fee. Plan recheck fees shall be invoiced at a rate to reimburse
direct costs on a time and materials basis as determined by the utilities
director. Plan checking is performed for both water and sewer concurrently.
      6.   Inspection Fee: Inspection fees shall be at a rate as determined by
the board and may be on a time and materials basis.
   R.   Subdivisions:
      1.   Application: Any person desiring to provide a water system within a
tract of land that he proposes to subdivide shall make written application to
LCUD. Such application shall contain streets or easements dedicated and
accepted by the county and/or all utility extensions to service the project or
subdivision and any required flow models or studies.
      2.   Contents: The application shall state the number of lots in the
tract, the name of the subdivision, and its location. It shall be accompanied
by a copy of the proposed final map, and of the plans, profiles and
specifications for the water and sewer infrastructure work therein.
      3.   Investigation: Upon receiving the application, the LCUD shall make
an investigation of the proposed subdivision and shall submit a written
response to the applicant stating what, if any, modifications need to be made.
      4.   Specifications And Construction: The size, type and quality of
materials and location of the lines shall be in accordance with development
standards and construction specifications accepted by Lyon County and shall be
approved by LCUD and will be inspected by LCUD or by an inspector approved by
LCUD.
      5.   Connections: The subdivider shall, at his cost, provide all
connections to premises within the subdivision.
      6.   Plan Checking Fee: Any person requiring approval of plans by LCUD,
or desiring plan checking shall pay to LCUD the plan check fee or fees
established by the board.
   S.   Will-Serve Letters/Water Rights Required:
      1.   Standards For Granting Or Denial Of Requests: No “will-serve”
letters shall be issued by LCUD for any project if in the director’s judgment,
it is likely that LCUD will be unable to serve the project to be connected to
LCUD’s water system, if the project does not meet the requirements of NAC 445A
or if sufficient water rights to support the project have not been provided. In
making this determination, LCUD shall take into account the estimated amount of
water that will be required to serve the entire project at full development,
and the amount of water LCUD is likely to have available at that time.
      2.   Effect Of “Will-Serve” Letter: The issuance of a “will-serve” letter
by LCUD shall obligate LCUD to reserve a connection for the project for which
the letter has been issued for the time period stated in the letter. This
section is declarative of LCUD’s existing policy and practice with respect to
“will-serve” letters.
      3.   Procedure For Consideration Of Requests For “Will-Serve” Letters:
Requests for “will-serve” letters shall be considered by the LCUD on a case by
case basis. Any person requesting a “will-serve” letter from LCUD shall submit
a written application provided by LCUD.
      4.   Required Assignment Of Water Rights: In addition to compliance with
all other standards for granting applications for connections, all applicants
shall be required to assign to LCUD water rights acceptable to LCUD in
sufficient quantity to support the project as determined by LCUD. Water rights
must be deeded to Lyon County and be in good standing, approved for point of
diversion and place and type of use by the state water engineer.
      5.   Water Rights Required: For any new connections or developments,
water rights must be deeded to the county in the amount determined by using the
following table and/or formula and meet the conditions in subsections S.5.a.,
S.5.b. and S.5.c. of this section.
         a.   The priority, quantity, drought year supply, yield and quality of
the water rights are sufficient to meet the demand of the project.
         b.   The water rights have been changed under applicable law to allow
their use by the county for municipal and industrial purposes, at the county’s
place of use and for diversion at the county’s points of diversion.
         c.   The applicant can show unencumbered and clear title to ownership
of the water rights.
Lot Size Or Multi-Family (Square Feet) Required Water Rights (AFA)

Commercial use water rights requirements will be calculated by performing a
